name: file
description:
Module Overview

This module contains functions to perform file system based operations such as create, delete, rename the file/directory, and retrieve metadata of the file.

For an example on the usage of the operations, see the File Example.

Directory Listener

The Directory Listener is used to listen to a directory in the local file system. It notifies when new files are created in the directory or when the existing files are deleted or modified.

For an example on the usage of the operations, see the Directory Listener Example.

modules.summary: This module contains functions to perform file system based operations such as create, delete, rename the file/directory, and retrieve metadata of the file.
modules.description:
Module Overview

This module contains functions to perform file system based operations such as create, delete, rename the file/directory, and retrieve metadata of the file.

For an example on the usage of the operations, see the File Example.

Directory Listener

The Directory Listener is used to listen to a directory in the local file system. It notifies when new files are created in the directory or when the existing files are deleted or modified.

For an example on the usage of the operations, see the Directory Listener Example.

fields.name: recursive
fields.description: Recursively monitor all sub folders or not in the given direcotry path

records.name: ListenerConfig
records.description: Represents configurations that required for directory listener.

fields.name: operation
fields.description: Triggered event action. This can be create, delete or modify

records.name: FileEvent
records.description: Represents an event which will trigger when there is a changes to listining direcotry.

fields.name: modifiedTime
fields.description: The last modified time of the file

fields.name: dir
fields.description: Whether the file is a directory or not

fields.name: readable
fields.description: Whether the file is readable or not

fields.name: writable
fields.description: Whether the file is writable or not

records.name: MetaData
records.description: Metadata record contains metadata information of a file. This record is returned by getMetaData function.

returnParameters.description: () or else error upon failure to attach to the service
() or else error upon failure to start the listener
() or else error upon failure to stop the listener
() or else error upon failure to stop the listener
() or else error upon failure to attach to the service
() or else error upon failure to detach to the service

methods.name: detach
methods.description: Stops listening to the directory and detaches the service from the file:Listener.

returnParameters.description: () or else error upon failure to start the listener
() or else error upon failure to stop the listener
() or else error upon failure to stop the listener
() or else error upon failure to detach to the service

otherMethods.name: detach
otherMethods.description: Stops listening to the directory and detaches the service from the file:Listener.

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description: Represents the directory listener endpoint, which is used to listen to a directory in the local file system.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: String value of the file path free from potential malicious codes

returnParameters.description: The absolute path reference or else a file:Error if the path cannot be derived

functions.name: getAbsolutePath
functions.description:
Retrieves the absolute path from the provided location.

 string|file:Error absolutePath = file:getAbsolutePath(<@untainted> "test.txt");

returnParameters.description: true if path is absolute, false otherwise, or else an file:Error occurred if the path is invalid

functions.name: isAbsolutePath
functions.description:
Reports whether the path is absolute. A path is absolute if it is independent of the current directory. On Unix, a path is absolute if it starts with the root. On Windows, a path is absolute if it has a prefix and starts with the root: c:\windows.

 boolean|file:Error isAbsolute = file:isAbsolutePath("/A/B/C");

returnParameters.description: The name of the file or else a file:Error if the path is invalid

functions.name: basename
functions.description:
Retrieves the base name of the file from the provided location, which is the last element of the path. Trailing path separators are removed before extracting the last element.

 string|file:Error name = file:basename("/A/B/C.txt");

returnParameters.description: Path of the parent directory or else a file:Error if an error occurred while getting the parent directory

functions.name: parentPath
functions.description:
Returns the enclosing parent directory. If the path is empty, parent returns ".". The returned path does not end in a separator unless it is the root directory.

 string|file:Error parentPath = file:parentPath("/A/B/C.txt");

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: Normalization option. Supported options are, CLEAN - Get the shortest path name equivalent to the given path by eliminating multiple separators, '.', and '..', SYMLINK - Evaluate a symlink, NORMCASE - Normalize the case of a pathname. On windows, all the characters are converted to lowercase and "/" is converted to "\".

returnParameters.description: Normalized file path or else a file:Error if the path is invalid

functions.name: normalizePath
functions.description:
Normalizes a path value.

 string|file:Error normalizedPath = file:normalizePath("foo/../bar", file:CLEAN);

returnParameters.description: String array of the part components or else a file:Error if the path is invalid

functions.name: splitPath
functions.description:
Splits a list of paths joined by the OS-specific path separator.

 string[]|file:Error parts = file:splitPath("/A/B/C");

parameters.name: parts
parameters.description: String values of the file path parts

returnParameters.description: String value of the file path or else a file:Error if the parts are invalid

functions.name: joinPath
functions.description:
Joins any number of path elements into a single path.

 string|file:Error path = file:joinPath("/", "foo", "bar");

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: String value of the base file path

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: String value of the target file path

returnParameters.description: The target path relative to the base path, or else an file:Error if target path cannot be made relative to the base path

functions.name: relativePath
functions.description:
Returns a relative path, which is logically equivalent to the target path when joined to the base path with an intervening separator. An error is returned if the target path cannot be made relative to the base path.

 string|file:Error relative = file:relativePath("a/b/e", "a/c/d");

returnParameters.description: Current working directory or else an empty string if the current working directory cannot be determined

functions.name: getCurrentDir
functions.description:
Returns the current working directory.

string dirPath = file:getCurrentDir();

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: Indicates whether the createDir should create non-existing parent directories. The default is only to create the given current directory.

returnParameters.description: A file:Error if the directory creation failed

functions.name: createDir
functions.description:
Creates a new directory with the specified name.

file:Error? results = file:createDir("foo/bar");

parameters.name: option
parameters.description: Indicates whether the remove should recursively remove all the files inside the given directory

returnParameters.description: An file:Error if failed to remove

functions.name: remove
functions.description:
Removes the specified file or directory.

file:Error? results = file:remove("foo/bar.txt");

parameters.name: oldPath
parameters.description: String value of the old file path

parameters.name: newPath
parameters.description: String value of the new file path

returnParameters.description: An file:Error if failed to rename

functions.name: rename
functions.description:
Renames(Moves) the old path with the new path. If the new path already exists and it is not a directory, this replaces the file.

file:Error? results = file:rename("/A/B/C", "/A/B/D");

returnParameters.description: A file:Error if file creation failed

functions.name: create
functions.description:
Creates a file in the specified file path. Truncates if the file already exists in the given path.

file:Error? results = file:create("bar.txt");

returnParameters.description: The MetaData instance with the file metadata or else an file:Error

functions.name: getMetaData
functions.description:
Returns the metadata information of the file specified in the file path.

file:MetaData | error result = file:getMetaData("foo/bar.txt");

returnParameters.description: The MetaData array or else an file:Error if there is an error

functions.name: readDir
functions.description:
Reads the directory and returns a list of metadata of files and directories inside the specified directory.

file:MetaData[] | error results = file:readDir("foo/bar");

parameters.name: sourcePath
parameters.description: String value of the old file path

parameters.name: destinationPath
parameters.description: String value of the new file path

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Parameter to denote how the copy operation should be done. Supported options are, REPLACE_EXISTING - Replace the target path if it already exists, COPY_ATTRIBUTES - Copy the file attributes as well to the target, NO_FOLLOW_LINKS - If source is a symlink, only the link is copied, not the target of the link.

returnParameters.description: An file:Error if failed to copy

functions.name: copy
functions.description:
Copy the file/directory in the old path to the new path.

file:Error? results = file:copy("/A/B/C", "/A/B/D", true);

parameters.name: dir
parameters.description: The directory path where the temp file should be created. If not specified, temp file will be created in the default temp directory of the OS.

returnParameters.description: Temporary file path or an error if one occured

functions.name: createTemp
functions.description:
Creates a temporary file.

string|error tmpFile = file:createTemp();

parameters.name: dir
parameters.description: The directory path where the temp directory should be created. If not specified, temp directory will be created in the default temp directory of the OS.

returnParameters.description: Temporary directory path or an error if one occured

functions.name: createTempDir
functions.description:
Creates a temporary directory.

string|error tmpDir = file:createTempDir();

parameters.name: testOption
parameters.description: The option to be tested upon the path. Supported options are, EXISTS - Test whether a file path exists, IS_DIR - Test whether a file path is a directory, IS_SYMLINK - Test whether a file path is a symlink, READABLE - Test whether a file path is readable, WRITABLE - Test whether a file path is writable.

returnParameters.description: True/false depending on the option to be tested, or else an error if one occurs

functions.name: test
functions.description:
Tests a file path against a test condition .

boolean|error result = file:test("foo/bar.txt", file:EXISTS);

errors.name: InvalidOperationError
errors.description: Represents an error that occurs when a file system operation is denied due to invalidity.

errors.name: PermissionError
errors.description: Represents an error that occurs when a file system operation is denied, due to the absence of file permission.

errors.name: FileSystemError
errors.description: Represents an error that occurs when a file system operation fails.

errors.name: FileNotFoundError
errors.description: Represents an error that occurs when the file/directory does not exist at the given filepath.

errors.name: NotLinkError
errors.description: Represents error occur when the file at the given filepath is not a symbolic link.

errors.name: IOError
errors.description: Represents IO error occur when trying to access the file at the given filepath.

errors.name: SecurityError
errors.description: Represents security error occur when trying to access the file at the given filepath.

errors.name: InvalidPathError
errors.description: Represents error occur when the given file path is invalid.

errors.name: InvalidPatternError
errors.description: Represent error occur when the given pattern is not a valid filepath pattern.

errors.name: RelativePathError
errors.description: Represents an error that occurs when the given target filepath cannot be derived relative to the base filepath.

errors.name: UNCPathError
errors.description: Represents error occur in the UNC path.
